docs.snippet: Eli Manning offered Peyton Manning some tips on playing at MetLife Stadium, Eli’s home field, in the Super Bowl. Peyton said thanks but that he needed tickets....
docs.lead_paragraph: Eli Manning offered Peyton Manning some tips on playing at MetLife Stadium, Eli’s home field, in the Super Bowl. Peyton said thanks but that he needed tickets.
docs.abstract: Bill Pennington On Pro Football column; when Eli Manning told his brother Peyton he would help him in any way needed as Peyton and Denver Broncos prepare to play in Super Bowl XLVIII at New York Giants' home field, MetLife Stadium, the response was clear; Peyton wants tickets for the game to help him keep friends and family happy.

headline.main: With Brother in Big Game, Eli Manning Plays Concierge
headline.print_headline: Super Bowl Troubles? The Concierge to the Star Quarterback Can Help

docs.snippet: The two teams in Super Bowl XLVIII will be billeted in two of the hotels that have remade the skyline of this old manufacturing city....
docs.lead_paragraph: The two teams in Super Bowl XLVIII will be billeted in two of the hotels that have remade the skyline of this old manufacturing city.
docs.abstract: Jersey City will host team and staff for the Seattle Seahawks and the Denver Broncos, in town for Super Bowl XLVIII, in hotels that have remade the transformed manufacturing city's skyline; teams will experience a city changed by migration of trend-conscious people to a city that used to be resolutely unfashionable (Series: Super Bowl XLVIII).

headline.main: Much Transformed, Jersey City Is Ready to House Super Bowl Teams
headline.print_headline: Much Transformed, Jersey City Is Ready to House Super Bowl Teams

docs.snippet: The family of former San Diego Chargers star Junior Seau, who killed himself in 2012, raised objections on Friday to a $760 million proposal to settle a lawsuit brought by thousands of former professional football players charging that the Nationa...
docs.lead_paragraph: The family of former San Diego Chargers star Junior Seau, who killed himself in 2012, raised objections on Friday to a $760 million proposal to settle a lawsuit brought by thousands of former professional football players charging that the National Football League downplayed the risk of concussions.

headline.main: Family of Ex-NFL Star Seau Objects to Concussion Lawsuit Settlement
headline.print_headline: Family of Ex-NFL Star Seau Objects to Concussion Lawsuit Settlement
